name: MiniLatex.Driver

values.name: getRenderedText
render
values.comment:
The function call render sourceTest produces an HTML string corresponding to the MiniLatex source text. Thus, if str = "\italic{Test:}\n\n$$a^2 + b^2 = c^2$$\n\n\strong{Q.E.D.}" then `render str` yields the HTML text

Test:

$$a^2 + b^2 = c^2$$

Q.E.D.

values.name: setup
values.comment:
Create an EditRecord from a string of MiniLaTeX text: > editRecord = setup str > { paragraphs = [ "\\italic{Test:}\n\n" , "$$a^2 + b^2 = c^2$$\n\n" , "\\strong{Q.E.D.}\n\n" ] , renderedParagraphs = [ "\n

\n Test:

" , "\n

\n $$a^2 + b^2 = c^2$$

" , "\n

\n Q.E.D.

" ] , latexState = { counters = Dict.fromList [ ( "eqno", 0 ), ( "s1", 0 ), ( "s2", 0 ), ( "s3", 0 ), ( "tno", 0 ) ] , crossReferences = Dict.fromList [] } } : MiniLatex.Differ.EditRecord

values.name: update
values.comment:
Update the given edit record with modified text.
Thus, if

str2 = "\italic{Test:}\n\n$$a^3 + b^3 = c^3$$\n\n\strong{Q.E.D.}"

then we can say

editRecord2 = update str2 editRecord

The `update` function attempts to re-render only the paragraph
which have been changed. It will always update the text correctly,
but its efficiency depends on the nature of the edit. This is
because the "differ" used to detect changes is rather crude.
